amount of collateral for the option, denominated in units of the token at the `_collateralERC` address","_collateralERC":"The address of the reference ERC-20 token to be used as collateral param _dataResolver The address of a service contract which will return the settlement price","_expiry":"The block height at which the option will expire","_isEuro":"If true, the option can only be settled at or after `_expiry` is reached, else it can be settled at any time","_isPut":"If true, the settlement claims will be calculated for a put option; else they will be calculated for a call option","_isRequest":"If true, will create the token as an \"RFP\" / request for a particular option","_lotSize":"A multiplier on the settlement price used to determine settlement claims","_strikePrice":"The strike value of the option, in the same units as the settlement price"}},"getOwnedPiggies(address)":{"details":"ERC-59 tokens assigned to the zero address are considered invalid, and this function throws for queries about the zero address.","params":{"_owner":"An address for which to query the balance of ERC-59 tokens"},"return":"The number of ERC-59 tokens owned by `_owner`, possibly zero"},"requestSettlementPrice(uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Throws if `_tokenId` is not a valid token. Throws if `_oracle` is not a valid contract address. Throws if `onMarket(_tokenId)` is true. If `isEuro` is true for the specified token, throws if `_expiry` > block.number. If `isEuro` is true for the specified token, throws if `_priceNow` is true. [OR specify that it flips that to false always (?)] If `priceNow` is true, throws if block.number > `_expiry` for the specified token. If `priceNow` is false, throws if block.number < `_expiry` for the specified token. If `priceNow` is true, calls the oracle to request the `_underlyingNow` value for the token. If `priceNow` is false, calls the oracle to request the `_underlyingExpiry` value for the token. Depending on the oracle service implemented, additional state will need to be referenced in order to call the oracle, e.g. an endpoint to fetch. This state handling will need to be managed on an implementation basis for specific oracle services.","params":{"_oracleFee":"Fee paid to oracle service A value needs to be provided for this function to succeed If the oracle doesn't need payment, include a positive garbage value","_tokenId":"The identifier of the token"},"return":"The settlement price from the oracle to be used in `settleOption()`"},"settlePiggy(uint256)":{"details":"Throws if `_tokenId` is not a valid ERC-59 token. Throws if msg.sender is not one of: seller, owner of `_tokenId`. Throws if `hasSettlementPrice(_tokenId)` is false."},"supportsInterface(bytes4)":{"details":"See `IERC165.supportsInterface`.     * Time complexity O(1), guaranteed to always use less than 30 000 gas."}},"title":"SmartBricks: A Smart Piggies Implementation"},"userdoc":{"methods":{"constructor":"constructor should throw if various things aren't properly set also should throw if the contract is not delegated an amount of collateral designated in the reference ERC-20 which is >= the collateral value of the functions"},"getOwnedPiggies(address)":{"notice":"Count the number of ERC-59 tokens owned by a particular address"},"requestSettlementPrice(uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Call the oracle to fetch the settlement price"},"settlePiggy(uint256)":{"notice":"Calculate the settlement of ownership of option nodes.documentation:
constructor should throw if various things aren't properly set
also should throw if the contract is not delegated an amount of collateral designated
in the reference ERC-20 which is >= the collateral value of the piggy

nodes.documentation:
@notice Call the oracle to fetch the settlement price
@dev Throws if `_tokenId` is not a valid token.
Throws if `_oracle` is not a valid contract address.
Throws if `onMarket(_tokenId)` is true.
If `isEuro` is true for the specified token, throws if `_expiry` > block.number.
If `isEuro` is true for the specified token, throws if `_priceNow` is true. [OR specify that it flips that to false always (?)]
If `priceNow` is true, throws if block.number > `_expiry` for the specified token.
If `priceNow` is false, throws if block.number < `_expiry` for the specified token.
If `priceNow` is true, calls the oracle to request the `_underlyingNow` value for the token.
If `priceNow` is false, calls the oracle to request the `_underlyingExpiry` value for the token.
Depending on the oracle service implemented, additional state will need to be referenced in
order to call the oracle, e.g. an endpoint to fetch. This state handling will need to be
managed on an implementation basis for specific oracle services.
@param _tokenId The identifier of the token
@param _oracleFee Fee paid to oracle service
A value needs to be provided for this function to succeed
If the oracle doesn't need payment, include a positive garbage value
@return The settlement price from the oracle to be used in `settleOption()`

nodes.documentation:
@notice Call the oracle to fetch the settlement price
@dev Throws if `_tokenId` is not a valid token.
Throws if `_oracle` is not a valid contract address.
Throws if `onMarket(_tokenId)` is true.
If `isEuro` is true for the specified token, throws if `_expiry` > block.number.
If `isEuro` is true for the specified token, throws if `_priceNow` is true. [OR specify that it flips that to false always (?)]
If `priceNow` is true, throws if block.number > `_expiry` for the specified token.
If `priceNow` is false, throws if block.number < `_expiry` for the specified token.
If `priceNow` is true, calls the oracle to request the `_underlyingNow` value for the token.
If `priceNow` is false, calls the oracle to request the `_underlyingExpiry` value for the token.
Depending on the oracle service implemented, additional state will need to be referenced in
order to call the oracle, e.g. an endpoint to fetch. This state handling will need to be
managed on an implementation basis for specific oracle services.
@param _tokenId The identifier of the token
@param _oracleFee Fee paid to oracle service
A value needs to be provided for this function to succeed
If the oracle doesn't need payment, include a positive garbage value
@return The settlement price from the oracle to be used in `settleOption()`

params._collateral: The amount of collateral for the option, denominated in units of the token at the `_collateralERC` address
params._collateralERC: The address of the reference ERC-20 token to be used as collateral param _dataResolver The address of a service contract which will return the settlement price
params._expiry: The block height at which the option will expire
params._isEuro: If true, the option can only be settled at or after `_expiry` is reached, else it can be settled at any time
params._isPut: If true, the settlement claims will be calculated for a put option; else they will be calculated for a call option
params._isRequest: If true, will create the token as an "RFP" / request for a particular option
params._lotSize: A multiplier on the settlement price used to determine settlement claims
params._strikePrice: The strike value of the option, in the same units as the settlement price

getOwnedPiggies(address).details: ERC-59 tokens assigned to the zero address are considered invalid, and this function throws for queries about the zero address.

params._owner: An address for which to query the balance of ERC-59 tokens

getOwnedPiggies(address).return: The number of ERC-59 tokens owned by `_owner`, possibly zero

requestSettlementPrice(uint256,uint256).details: Throws if `_tokenId` is not a valid token. Throws if `_oracle` is not a valid contract address. Throws if `onMarket(_tokenId)` is true. If `isEuro` is true for the specified token, throws if `_expiry` > block.number. If `isEuro` is true for the specified token, throws if `_priceNow` is true. [OR specify that it flips that to false always (?)] If `priceNow` is true, throws if block.number > `_expiry` for the specified token. If `priceNow` is false, throws if block.number < `_expiry` for the specified token. If `priceNow` is true, calls the oracle to request the `_underlyingNow` value for the token. If `priceNow` is false, calls the oracle to request the `_underlyingExpiry` value for the token. Depending on the oracle service implemented, additional state will need to be referenced in order to call the oracle, e.g. an endpoint to fetch. This state handling will need to be managed on an implementation basis for specific oracle services.

params._oracleFee: Fee paid to oracle service A value needs to be provided for this function to succeed If the oracle doesn't need payment, include a positive garbage value

requestSettlementPrice(uint256,uint256).return: The settlement price from the oracle to be used in `settleOption()`

settlePiggy(uint256).details: Throws if `_tokenId` is not a valid ERC-59 token. Throws if msg.sender is not one of: seller, owner of `_tokenId`. Throws if `hasSettlementPrice(_tokenId)` is false.

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: See `IERC165.supportsInterface`.     * Time complexity O(1), guaranteed to always use less than 30 000 gas.

methods.constructor: constructor should throw if various things aren't properly set also should throw if the contract is not delegated an amount of collateral designated in the reference ERC-20 which is >= the collateral value of the piggy

getOwnedPiggies(address).notice: Count the number of ERC-59 tokens owned by a particular address

requestSettlementPrice(uint256,uint256).notice: Call the oracle to fetch the settlement price

settlePiggy(uint256).notice: Calculate the settlement of ownership of option collateral
